data.enText: one of two long sticks that you put under your arms to help you walk after you have injured your leg or foot

data.chText: 事故后我用了六个月的腋杖。
data.enText: After the accident I spent six months on crutches .
a person or thing that gives you help or support but often makes you depend on them too much

tr: anything that serves as an expedient
example: he uses drugs as a psychological crutch

tr: a wooden or metal staff that fits under the armpit and reaches to the ground
used by disabled person while walking

value.def: A crutch is a stick whose top fits round or under the user's arm, which someone with an injured foot or leg uses to support their weight when walking.

example.ex: I can walk without the aid of crutches...
example.tran: 我不用拐杖也能自己走。

example.ex: I was on crutches for a while.

value.tran: (腿或脚受伤的人用的)腋杖，拐杖

value.def: If you refer to someone or something as a crutch, you mean that they give you help or support.

example.ex: The calculator is a tool, not a crutch; yet it is increasingly being used as a crutch by many children...
example.tran: 计算器是工具，不是拐杖，可是现在很多孩子越来越依赖它。

example.ex: He gave up the crutch of alcohol.

value.def: Your crutch is the same as your crotch .

example.ex: He kicked him in the crutch.
